B E L G I U M

An integrated multi-disciplinary field program is outlined that addresses the rapid and fundamental changes now taking place across the Antarctic Peninsula region. By making use of a marine research platform we can bring glaciologists, oceanographers, marine geologists and biologists together on the same team, working collaboratively to answer vital questions.
An integrated multi-disciplinary field program is outlined that addresses the
rapid and fundamental changes now taking place across the Antarctic
Peninsula region. By making use of a marine research platform we can
bring glaciologists, oceanographers, marine geologists and biologists
together on the same team, working collaboratively to answer vital
questions.

page.enlisting:
Terrestrial Glaciology supported by helicopter off Palmer & BAS twin otter - Flow dynamics of tributary glaciers (Scambos, Skvarca, with BAS ?) - Ice Core paleoclimate across Peninsula domes (Thompson & Mosley-Thompson et al.) - GPS crustal rebound reconnaissance (Scambos et al.?) Marine Biology, Geology & Oceanography on Palmer - Paleohistory of Larsen system from marine sediment cores (Domack & Leventer et al.) - Investigation of chemoautotrophic ecosystem in sub- Larsen system (Canals & DeBatist et al.,) - Physical Oceanography and Bottom water dynamics (Gordon & Huber et al., Padman) Terrestrial Glaciology supported by helicopter off Palmer & BAS twin otter - Flow dynamics of tributary glaciers (Scambos, Skvarca, with BAS ?) - Ice Core paleoclimate across Peninsula domes (Thompson & Mosley-Thompson et al.) - GPS crustal rebound reconnaissance (Scambos et al.?)

Questions to be addressed during APIS-IPY effort in this project
Questions to be addressed during APIS-IPY effort in this project

-the stability of the Larsen Ice Shelf and Antarctic Peninsula ice sheet
-the stability of the Larsen Ice Shelf and Antarctic Peninsula ice sheet

-the integration of paleoclimate records from marine and lacustrine sediment cores
-the integration of paleoclimate records from marine and lacustrine
sediment cores

-the response of, or contribution of, oceanographic systems to ice shelf disintegration
-the response of, or contribution of, oceanographic systems to ice
shelf disintegration

-the climate history of the Peninsula as recorded in ice cores, and
-the climate history of the Peninsula as recorded in ice cores, and
